name: Sodium bisulfate
desc: Sodium bisulfate, also known as sodium hydrogen sulfate, is the sodium salt of the bisulfate anion, with the molecular formula NaHSO4. Sodium bisulfate is an acid salt formed by partial neutralization of sulfuric acid by an equivalent of sodium base, typically either in the form of sodium hydroxide or sodium chloride. It is a dry granular product that can be safely shipped and stored. The anhydrous form is hygroscopic. Solutions of sodium bisulfate are acidic, with a 1M solution having a pH of around 1.

images.alt: One sodium cation and one hydrogensulfate anion
Sodium bisulfate, as a white powder, turns indicator paper red.

Other names:
Sodium acid sulfate
Bisulfate of soda
Boiling point: decomposes to Na2S2O7 (+ H2O) at 315 °C (599 °F; 588 K)
